snippet: Florida’s commissioner of education resigned after news reports said he had changed the grade of an Indiana charter school whose founder donated to a campaign of his.
abstract: Tony Bennett, Florida's commissioner of education, resigns after news reports said he had changed the grade of an Indiana charter school founded by prominent campaign donor while he was superintendent of schools there; Bennett was rising star in national movement pushing for test-based accountability in public schools.
lead_paragraph: Florida’s commissioner of education resigned after news reports said he had changed the grade of an Indiana charter school whose founder donated to a campaign of his.

headline.main: Florida’s Education Chief Quits Amid Report That He Changed a School’s Rating
headline.print_headline: Florida’s Education Chief Quits Amid Report That He Changed a School’s Rating
